page.title: 09WESTMILL FARM, WARE
page.content: Mr.Vigus has farmed here for over 43 years. In the past he kept cows and at one time had 1000 pigs but now it is a {sheep farm.}His 350 ewes averaged 1.8 lambs this year. At 12 weeks old each lamb fetches Â£45 when sold for meat. One shepherd is employed and extra hands are hired for harvesting and for shearing in June.{Shearing}takes three minutes per sheep.Each fleece is worth Â£4. The sheep are{dipped}in July and September to rid them of sheep scab. The shepherd trains{15 dogs}and has won sheepdog trials.He grazes sheep on 60 acres, moving them around every ten days. Although there are over 80 acres of grassland,not all of it is healthy. (See page 8). One field grazes horses. The farmer also has 50 acres of land growing{rape,wheat and barley}which he rotates each year. He first grew rape four years ago.
